Package org.zaproxy.zap.control

Class AddOnInstaller

java.lang.Object
org.zaproxy.zap.control.AddOnInstaller
public final class AddOnInstaller extends Object
Helper class responsible to install and uninstall add-ons and all its (dynamically installable) components (Extensions, Plugins, and files).
Since:
2.3.0
See Also:
  • Extension
  • Plugin

  • Method Details

    • install

      public static void install(AddOnClassLoader addOnClassLoader, AddOn addOn)
      Installs all the (dynamically installable) components (Extensions, Plugins, and files) of the given addOn.

      It's also responsible to notify the installed extensions when the installation has finished by calling the method Extension#postInstall().

      The components are installed in the following order:

      1. ResourceBundle
      2. Files
      3. Extensions
      4. Active scanners
      The files are installed first as they might be required by extensions and scanners.
      Parameters:
      addOnClassLoader - the class loader of the given addOn
      addOn - the add-on that will be installed
      See Also:
      • Extension
      • Plugin
      • Extension.postInstall()

    • uninstall

      @Deprecated public static boolean uninstall(AddOn addOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback callback)
      Deprecated.
      (2.8.0) Use uninstall(AddOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback, Set) instead.
      Uninstalls all the (dynamically installable) components (Extensions, Plugins, and files) of the given addOn.

      The components are uninstalled in the following order (inverse to installation):

      1. Active scanners
      2. Extensions
      3. Files
      4. ResourceBundle
      Parameters:
      addOn - the add-on that will be uninstalled
      callback - the callback that will be notified of the progress of the uninstallation
      Returns:
      true if the add-on was uninstalled without errors, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if addOn or callback are null.
      See Also:
      • softUninstall(AddOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback)
      • Extension
      • Plugin

    • uninstall

      @Deprecated public static boolean uninstall(AddOn addOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback callback, Set<AddOn> installedAddOns)
      Deprecated.
      (2.13.0) Use uninstall(AddOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback, Set, PostponedTasksRunner) instead.
      Uninstalls all the (dynamically installable) components (Extensions, Plugins, and files) of the given addOn.

      The components are uninstalled in the following order (inverse to installation):

      1. Active scanners
      2. Extensions
      3. ResourceBundle, of the extensions and the add-on
      4. Files (if not in use by other add-ons)
      Parameters:
      addOn - the add-on that will be uninstalled.
      callback - the callback that will be notified of the progress of the uninstallation.
      installedAddOns - the add-ons currently installed.
      Returns:
      true if the add-on was uninstalled without errors, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if addOn or callback are null.
      Since:
      2.8.0
      See Also:
      • softUninstall(AddOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback)
      • Extension
      • Plugin

    • uninstall

      public static boolean uninstall(AddOn addOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback callback, Set<AddOn> installedAddOns, org.zaproxy.zap.control.PostponedTasksRunner postponedTasks)
      Uninstalls all the (dynamically installable) components (Extensions, Plugins, and files) of the given addOn.

      The components are uninstalled in the following order (inverse to installation):

      1. Active scanners
      2. Extensions
      3. Files (if not in use by other add-ons)
      4. ResourceBundle
      Parameters:
      addOn - the add-on that will be uninstalled.
      callback - the callback that will be notified of the progress of the uninstallation.
      installedAddOns - the add-ons currently installed.
      postponedTasks - the container for postponed tasks.
      Returns:
      true if the add-on was uninstalled without errors, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if addOn or callback are null.
      Since:
      2.13.0
      See Also:
      • softUninstall(AddOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback)
      • Extension
      • Plugin

    • softUninstall

      public static boolean softUninstall(AddOn addOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback callback)
      Uninstalls Java classes (Extensions, Plugins) and the ResourceBundles of the given addOn. Should be called when the add-on must be temporarily uninstalled for an update of a dependency.

      The Java classes are uninstalled in the following order (inverse to installation):

      1. Active scanners;
      2. Extensions.
      Parameters:
      addOn - the add-on that will be softly uninstalled
      callback - the callback that will be notified of the progress of the uninstallation
      Returns:
      true if the add-on was uninstalled without errors, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • Extension
      • Plugin

    • installAddOnExtension

      public static void installAddOnExtension(AddOn addOn, Extension ext)

    • uninstallAddOnExtension

      protected static boolean uninstallAddOnExtension(AddOn addOn, Extension extension, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback callback)
      Uninstalls the given extension.
      Parameters:
      addOn - the add-on that has the extension
      extension - the extension that should be uninstalled
      callback - the callback that will be notified of the progress of the uninstallation
      Returns:
      true if the extension was uninstalled without errors, false otherwise.
      Since:
      2.4.0
      See Also:
      • Extension

    • installMissingAddOnFiles

      public static void installMissingAddOnFiles(AddOnClassLoader addOnClassLoader, AddOn addOn)
      Installs all the missing files declared by the given addOn.
      Parameters:
      addOnClassLoader - the class loader of the given addOn
      addOn - the add-on that will have the missing declared files installed

    • updateAddOnFiles

      public static void updateAddOnFiles(AddOnClassLoader addOnClassLoader, AddOn addOn)
      Updates the files declared by the given addOn.
      Parameters:
      addOnClassLoader - the class loader of the given addOn.
      addOn - the add-on that will have the declared files updated.
      Since:
      2.7.0

    • uninstallAddOnFiles

      @Deprecated public static boolean uninstallAddOnFiles(AddOn addOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback callback)
      Deprecated.
      (2.8.0) Use uninstallAddOnFiles(AddOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback, Set) instead.
      Uninstalls the files of the given add-on.
      Parameters:
      addOn - the add-on
      callback - the callback for notification of progress
      Returns:
      true if no error occurred while removing the files, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if addOn or callback are null.

    • uninstallAddOnFiles

      @Deprecated public static boolean uninstallAddOnFiles(AddOn addOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback callback, Set<AddOn> installedAddOns)
      Deprecated.
      (2.13.0) Use uninstallAddOnFiles(AddOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback, Set, PostponedTasksRunner) instead.
      Uninstalls the files of the given add-on.

      Note: Files that are in use by other installed add-ons are not uninstalled.

      Parameters:
      addOn - the add-on whose files should be uninstalled.
      callback - the callback for notification of progress.
      installedAddOns - the add-ons currently installed (to check if the files can be safely uninstalled).
      Returns:
      true if no error occurred while removing the files, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if addOn or callback are null.
      Since:
      2.8.0

    • uninstallAddOnFiles

      public static boolean uninstallAddOnFiles(AddOn addOn, AddOnUninstallationProgressCallback callback, Set<AddOn> installedAddOns, org.zaproxy.zap.control.PostponedTasksRunner postponedTasks)
      Uninstalls the files of the given add-on.

      Note: Files that are in use by other installed add-ons are not uninstalled.

      Parameters:
      addOn - the add-on whose files should be uninstalled.
      callback - the callback for notification of progress.
      installedAddOns - the add-ons currently installed (to check if the files can be safely uninstalled).
      postponedTasks - the container for postponed tasks.
      Returns:
      true if no error occurred while removing the files, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if addOn or callback are null.
      Since:
      2.13.0
